subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] How to use Jerome font?
msgSnippet: Lyle, You might want to check out this page
messageBody:
Lyle,

You might want to check out this page
http://f3.grp.yahoofs.com/v1/sBORQRyyaMWgJqjKnQW2KE6AsLhtyWVT3oKmKLUCEktfp4W-yEp560fyQRXnt270yBAZd35Qfys5c-JkkHzfJ6Ija51e/Resources/Second%20Shaw.htm

which explains some of the mapping of the Jerome font. At the time that I created it, there was a somewhat "standard" mapping of the "First Shaw" or Shavian alphabet. As this was the first font created specifically for the Second Shaw "Read" alphabet, I thought it wise to build upon the mapping for the Shavian alphabet for maximum compatibility, using Shavian translation programs already in existence, etc.

Unfortunately, my page takes that mapping for granted, and only explicitly states the mapping for the letters that aren't in the Shavian alphabet.

Here's some documentation on the mapping of the main letters at:
http://www.demeyere.com/shavian/shavian.pdf


-------Original Message-------

> Jerome font?  Or shall I just rely on trial and error?
